main_definition: Fields refer to areas of open land, usually covered in grass or crops, often used for agricultural purposes; it can also denote an area of expertise or a unit of measurement.

meanings_and_examples.example: The farmer spent his days tending to the fields outside his home.
She planted rows of corn and wheat in the vast fields behind her house.
He measured the space where he wanted to build a fence, calculating it in acres (fields).
Her extensive knowledge about literature and poetry can be considered as her fields.
The soccer field was freshly mowed, ready for the championship match.
